meanings.definition: Regarding humans as the central or most important element of existence.
meanings.sent1: The anthropocentricity view values human life above all else.
meanings.sent2: Her anthropocentricity perspective influenced her decisions.
meanings.sent3: The anthropocentricity approach to problem-solving often overlooks other species.
meanings.sent4: His anthropocentricity mindset blinded him to the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The anthropocentricity belief shapes our interactions with the environment.

meanings.definition: The belief that human beings are the most significant entity in the universe.
meanings.sent1: Anthropocentricity can lead to a lack of empathy towards other creatures.
meanings.sent2: The concept of anthropocentricity has been debated for centuries.
meanings.sent3: In a world of anthropocentricity, animals often suffer neglect.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of anthropocentricity looms large over environmental discussions.
meanings.sent5: Anthropocentricity can hinder our ability to appreciate the interconnectedness of all life.

meanings.definition: The perspective that places human interests and values above all others.
meanings.sent1: Anthropocentricity can sometimes lead to disregard for the well-being of other species.
meanings.sent2: The philosophy of anthropocentricity has shaped many societal norms.
meanings.sent3: In a tale of anthropocentricity, the animals outsmarted the humans.
meanings.sent4: The weight of anthropocentricity can be felt in our treatment of the environment.
meanings.sent5: Anthropocentricity blinds us to the richness of the world beyond human concerns.
